channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2024070212
item.description:
Report E-2024070212

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-16T09:14:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-16
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9200
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC trailer was overfilled during the loading process. Approximately 100 gallons of molten sulphur was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024070923
item.description:
Report X-2024070923

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 box for a cylinder of Freon 134a automotive refrigerant 30-lb wet but cylinder was undamaged. Package was wet due to leakage from another package. Package is undeclared hazmat due to content display non-flammable gas diamond while outer packaging doesn't display any hazmat markings.

item.title: Report E-2024070189
item.description:
Report E-2024070189

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 1, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one half (0.5) of a gallon of paint to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC overpacked the damaged pails in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all impacted material in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.
